SENT.plain: Infarction of the posterior cerebral artery may present only with signs of agitated delirium and an acute confusional state
In the absence of other prominent neurological deficits, this can be easily mistaken for toxic-metabolic encephalopathy, head trauma, post-ictal confusion, or a psychiatric disorder
Appropriate head imaging studies are important to detect an illness that might otherwise be missed and left untreated
